awd_titl_txt: Detection of Subsurface Objects Using Special-Analysis-of-  Surface-Waves
awd_abstract_narration: The main objective of this research is to explore the feasibility               of coupling the Spectral-Analysis-of-Surface-Waves (SASW) method                for the detection and delineation of underground cavities with                  the concept of geotomography, so that a three-dimensional mapping               of subsurface features can be accomplished. The presence of                     subsurface voids and objects can cause serious challenges for                   structural, geotechnical, and environmental engineers, and can                  jeopardize public safety. Therefore, methods are needed to locate               such features as part of the site investigation program in                      suspect areas. SASW method with the proposed enhancement will                   provide such a means.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
